Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: Thebes. City of the Living. Crown jewel of Pharaoh Seti the First.

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: Home of Imhotep, High Priest of Osiris, Keeper of the Dead.

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: Birthplace of Anck-su-namun. Pharaoh's Mistress. No other man was allowed to touch her.

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: But for our love, we were willing to risk life itself.

Speaker: pharaoh
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: pharaoh
Dialogue: WHO HAS TOUCHED YOU?!

Speaker: pharaoh
Dialogue: Imhotep?... My priest.

Speaker: priests
Dialogue: Pharaoh's bodyguards!

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Her body was mummified, her vital organs removed and placed in sacred canopic jars.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: The Book of The Living contained sacred incantations that would send the evil dead on a journey into the dark underworld.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: The slaves were killed...

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: ...and the soldiers who killed them were also slain, so that no unholy person should ever know the exact location of the burial site.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: But there was another book, The Book Of The Dead, which was never to be opened, never to be read, for it contained the incantations that could bring a dead body back to life a most unholy thing.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: It was hidden at Hamunaptra, City of the Dead, inside the statue of Anubis, so that no such sacrilege might ever disgrace Egypt.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: But for my love of Anck-su-namun I was willing to defy the gods.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Anck-su-namun's vital organs were still fresh, so a human sacrifice would not need be made.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Anck-su-namun soul had come back from the dead! Now all that was needed, was to return her organs to their rightful place within her body.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: My Priests were condemned to be mummified alive.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: As for me, I was condemned to endure the HOM-DAI. The worst of all ancient curses. One so horrible, it had never before been bestowed.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: By eating the sacred scarabs, I would be cursed to stay alive forever. And by eating me, they were cursed just the same.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: I was to remain sealed inside my sarcophagus, the undead for all of eternity.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: They would never allow me to be released. For I would arise a walking disease, a plague upon mankind, an unholy flesh-eater, with the strength of ages, power over the sands, and the glory of invincibility.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: And if I could raise my beloved Anck- su-namun from her place in hell, together, we would be an unstoppable infection upon this world. The Apocalypse. The End.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Personally, I would like to surrender. Why can we not just surrender?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Then let's run away. Right now. While we can still make it.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Then let's play dead, huh? Nobody ever does that anymore.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: In the desert? What for?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: I got caught robbing a synagogue. Lots of good stuff in them holy places; churches, temples, mosques, and who's guarding them?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Exactly! I speak seven languages, including Hebrew, so my specialty was synagogues. How about you? Kill somebody?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: What then? Robbery? Extortion? Kidnapping!

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Then what the hell are you doing here!?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Tuthmosis?... Now how did you get up here?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: OHEIUGM!! AHHHHHH!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oops.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Look at this! Sons of the Messiah! Give me frogs, flies, locusts, anything but this! Compared to you, the other plagues were a joy!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I'm sorry, it was an accident.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: When Ramesses destroyed Syria, it was an accident. You are a catastrophe! Why do I put up with you?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You put up with me, because I can read and write ancient Egyptian, decipher hieroglyphs and hieratic, and I'm the only person within a thousand miles who knows how to properly code and catalogue this library.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Who needs smart women? I put up with you because your mother and father were our finest patrons, Allah rest their souls. Now straighten up this mess!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Abdul? Mohammed? Bob?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You...! YOU...!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Drunkard? Fool? Rat-bastard? Please call me something original.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Have you no respect for the dead?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Right now, I only wish to join them.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Well I wish you'd do it sooner rather than later, before you ruin my career the way you've ruined yours.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: My dear, sweet, baby sister, I'll have you know, that at this moment my career is on a high note.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: High note? Ha! For five years you've been scrounging around Egypt, and what have you to show for it? Nothing.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Oh yes I do! I have something right here!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh no, not another worthless trinket, Jonathan, if I bring one more piece of junk to the Curator to try and sell for you.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Where did you get this?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: On a dig, down in Thebes.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: My whole life I've never found anything, Evy. Tell me I've found something.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Jonathan?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I think you found something.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: See the cartouche there, it's the official royal seal of Seti the First, I'm sure of it.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Perhaps.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Two questions. Who the hell is Seti the First? And was he rich?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: He was the last Pharaoh of the Old Kingdom, said to be the wealthiest Pharaoh of them all.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Alright, good, that's good. I like this fellow, like him very much.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I've already dated it, this map is almost four thousand years old. And the hieratics over here...  It's Hamunaptra.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: My dear girl, don't be ridiculous, we are scholars, not treasure hunters. Hamunaptra is a myth.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Are we talking about the Hamunaptra?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes. The City of The Dead. Where the early Pharaohs were said to have hidden the wealth of Egypt.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Right, right, in a big underground treasure chamber. Everybody knows the story. The entire necropolis was rigged to sink into the sand. On Pharaoh's command, a flick of the switch! And the whole place could disappear beneath the dunes.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: All we know is that the city mysteriously vanished around 2,134 B.C.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: As the Americans would say: it's all fairy tales and hokum.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: You burned it! You burned off the part with the lost city!

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: It's for the best, I'm sure. Many men have wasted their lives in the foolish pursuit of Hamunaptra, no one has ever found it, most have never returned.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: You killed my map.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: I'm sure it was a fake, anyway, I'm surprised at you, Miss Carnarvon, to be so fooled.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You told me you found it on a dig down in Thebes!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I was mistaken.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You lied to me!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I lie to everybody, what makes you so special?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I'm your sister.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: That just makes you more gullible.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You stole it from a drunk at the local Casbah?!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Picked his pocket, actually.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: And what is he in prison for?

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: I did not know, so when I heard you were coming, I asked him that myself.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: And what did he say?

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: He said... he was just looking for a good time.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: But he's just a filthy criminal?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Way to go, Evy.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Broad?!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: She's my sister, actually.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: I'll be back in a moment.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: We uh,... found... your puzzle box, and we've come to ask you about it.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: How do you know the box pertains to Hamunaptra?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: How do we know that's not a load of pig swallow?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Um, well, you see...

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You were actually at Hamunaptra?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes, well...  I know my brother.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You swear?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No, I mean --

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: What did you find? What did you see?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Could you tell me how to get there? The exact location?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Where are they taking him?

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: To be hanged.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Apparently, he had a very good time.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: No women allowed.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I am an English woman.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I will give you one hundred pounds to spare his life.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: I would pay one hundred pounds just to see him hang.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Two hundred pounds.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Proceed!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Three hundred pounds!

Speaker: hangman
Dialogue: Any last requests, pig?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: FIVE HUNDRED POUNDS!

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: And what else?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: NOOO!

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: His neck did not break! Good! Now we watch him strangle to death.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: He knows the location to Hamunaptra.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: You lie.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I would never!

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Are you saying this filthy godless son of a pig knows where to find The City Of The Dead? Truly?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes and if you cut him down, we will give you ten percent.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Fifty percent.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Twenty.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Forty.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Twenty-five percent, and not one single farthing more.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: She must die.

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: She is like all the others. She will die in the desert.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: No! She has seen too much. She knows too much.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Not only does she have a map, but she has the key.

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: The key!? She has the lost key!?

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Yes. No one has ever had so much, been so close. We must stop her, or it will be the end of us all.

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: Then we will kill her, we will kill her and all those with her.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: And burn the map and retrieve the key.

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: It will be done. But what of the American expedition? They leave tomorrow as well.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Forget the bumbling Americans, they will be like all the others. Without the map to guide them, how can they possibly find Hamunaptra?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: It is three days down the Nile, then two days by camel, sahibs.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: For all the money we're paying you, something better god-damned well be under that sand.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: "Hamunaptra," Daniels, that's all ya gotta keep sayin, to yourself, "Hamunaptra."

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Do you really think he'll show up?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Undoubtedly, I know the breed, he may be a cowboy, but his word is his word.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Personally, I think he's filthy, rude and a complete scoundrel. I don't like him one bit.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh... um,... hello.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Smashing day for the start of an adventure, eh, O'Connell?

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: You're sure Hamunaptra is out there?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Along with the scorched bones of my entire garrison, sahib.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: A thousand pardons, my good sahibs but there is much work to be done.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Mister O'Connell, can you look me in the eye, and guarantee me this is not some sort of flimflam? Because if it is, I'm warning you --

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes, yes, you're right, filthy, rude, a complete scoundrel, nothing to like there at all.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: A bright good morning to all.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: I have come to protect my investment, thank you very much.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Sit down, O'Connell, sit down, we could use another good player.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Never? What if I were to wager five hundred dollars says we get to Hamunaptra before you?

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: What makes you so confident, sir?

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: We got us a man who's actually been there.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I say, what a coincidence, why --

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: -- whose deal is it? Is it my deal? I thought I just dealt?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: The only thing that scares me, Mister O'Connell, are your manners.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: If you call that a kiss.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Did I miss something? Are we going into battle?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes, I'm hoping to find a certain artifact, a book, actually, my brother thinks there's treasure. What do you think is out there?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Ahmar is Ossirion. "Passageway to the underworld", actually.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I don't believe in fairy tales and hokum, Mister O'Connell, but I do believe that one of the most famous books in history is buried out there, The Book Of The Living. It's what first interested me in Egypt as a child. It's why I came here, sort of a life's pursuit.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You know your history.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: By the way,... why did you kiss me?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: My very good friend! What a surprise.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: You never were any good with the ladies, O'Connell.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Unfortunately no, these Americans are smart, they pay me only half now, half when I get them back to Cairo, so I must go all the way.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: You never believed in Hamunaptra, O'Connell. Why are you going back? The devil himself lives out there.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: You always did have more balls than brains.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Even?

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: Where is the map?

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: And the key? Where is the key?

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: Then I'll find it myself.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: The map! We need the map!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh that's comforting.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: EVY!!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Hey that's mine --

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Well of course I can swim, if the occasion calls for it.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Americans.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I say! Good show!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And did I panic?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I think not.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Hey O'Connell! Looks to me like I got all the horses!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I can't believe the price of these fleabags.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes, awfully tempting, wasn't it?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Never did like camels. Filthy buggers. They smell, they bite, they spit. Disgusting.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Well I think they're cute.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And you snore!

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: I do not snore!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: All night you snored!

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: I have never snored!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: What in bloody hell is this?

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Other seekers of Hamunaptra.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Good morning, my friend!

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Well, what the hell we doin'?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Patience, my good sahib, patience.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: First one to the city, O'Connell! Five hundred! Cash bucks!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: SEE YA THERE, O'CONNELL!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Ah, begging your pardon, but shouldn't we be going?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: After all, you rode us night and day to win that bet.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Fools.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Where'd all these camels come from?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: They belong to the dead. They will wait years for their masters to return before leaving.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: That thing gives me the creeps.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: That "thing" gets me excited.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: According to Bembridge Scholars, inside the statue of Anubis was a secret compartment, perhaps containing The Book Of The Living.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Ancient Egyptian trick. You'll see.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Do you realize, we are standing inside a room that no one has entered in over four thousand years.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Who cares? I don't see no treasure.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And it stinks to high heaven in here.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Cretins.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh my god, It's a preparation room.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: For entering the afterlife.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Mummies, my good son, this is where they made the mummies.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Ya scared the bejeezus out of us, O'Connell.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: This here is our statue,... friend.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Ten to one, O'Connell, your odds are no-so-good.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes, me too.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Let's be nice, children, if we're going to play together, we must learn to share.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: According to my calculations, we should be right under the statue. We'll come up right between his legs.  Oh my.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And when those dirty Yanks go to sleep --  No offense.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: We'll sneak up and steal that book right out from under them.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes, if their Egyptologist hasn't already found it.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I say, what's our smelly little friend got himself up to?

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: Seti was no fool.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Yeah, sure...

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: We'll let him open it.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: OWCH! That's really got to hurt.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: It's called mummification. You're dead when they do this

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Still...

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You two are worse than a couple of schoolboys.

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: FENI!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh my god,... it looks like, it looks like a sarcophagus.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: They didn't, they buried him at the foot of Anubis. He was either someone of great importance. Or he did something very naughty.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Well?... Who is it?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: 'He that shall not be named.'

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Quarried granite with a cobalt lining.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Whoever's in here, sure wasn't getting out.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: A key! That's it! That's what he was talking about.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: The man on the barge. The one with the hook, he was looking for a key.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Hey that's mine!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: What do you suppose killed him?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Did you ever see him eat?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Maybe this place really is cursed.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You two!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No. I believe if I can see it and I can touch it, then it's real. That's what I believe.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Seagrams!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Well, he may have been a stinky fellow,... but he had good taste.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Evy! Excuse me! But didn't the man just say -- !

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Just looking for you, O'Connell! I wanted to be with my friend!

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Why do you like to fight so much?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Let 'em have it, boys!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I say, bloody good show.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: LEAVE THIS PLACE!... LEAVE THIS PLACE OR DIE!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes,... fine,... thank you.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: See! That proves it! Old Seti's fortune's gotta be under this sand!

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: For them to protect it like this, you just know there's got to be treasure down there.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Where's Jonathan?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Unlike my brother, sir, I know when to say no.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I know, you're wondering, what's a place like me doing in a girl like this?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Egypt is in my blood. My father was a famous explorer, he loved Egypt so much that he married an Egyptian. My mother! Who was quite an adventurer herself

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I may not be an explorer, or an adventurer, or a treasure hunter, or a gunfighter! Mister O'Connell But I'm proud of what I am.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: ...I am a librarian!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I'm going to kiss you, Mister O'Connell.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I'm not?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Why would I do that?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I can't believe I allowed the two of you to get me drunk.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Don't blame me, I don't even remember being there.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Well neither do I, thank you.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No... Why?... Should I?

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: There is a curse upon this chest.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Curse my ass.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Yeah, who cares.

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: In these hallowed grounds, that which was set forth in ancient times, is as strong today, as it was then.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, okay, what's it --

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: "Death will come on swift wings to whomever opens this chest".

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: It says, there is one, the undead, who if brought back to life, is bound by sacred law to consummate this curse.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Yeah, well, let's just make sure we don't bring anybody back from the dead then, huh?

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: He will kill all who open this chest,... and assimilate their organs and fluids.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Assimilate their organs and fluids? Ya mean eat 'em?

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: And in so doing he will regenerate. And no longer be the undead, but a plague upon this earth.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Ah hell, let's open it anyways.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh my god, I've dreamed about this ever since I was a little girl.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Look, all the sacred spells have been chiseled off. The hieratics and hieroglyphs that protect the deceased on his journey into the afterlife, they've been removed. This man was cursed,... doomed.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes, I'm all tears, now let's see who's inside, shall we?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: The curse,... beware the curse!

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Stupid superstitious bastard.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No. I've never seen a mummy look like this. He's, he's still...

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Juicy?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes. He's more than four thousand years old and still decomposing.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh my god, he was buried alive.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: And he left a message.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: It says: 'Death is only the beginning.'

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: What are you going to do? Shoot him?

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: I have heard told of this book, but I never truly believed it existed. This, good gentlemen, is a most priceless treasure.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: I wouldn't trade ya for a brass spittoon!

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Yeah! It's supposed to be made outta pure gold!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: What is this stuff? It smells like our late friend, the Warden.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: You did not!?... We're not!?

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Say O'Connell, whadaya think these honey's'll fetch back home?

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: We hear you gentlemen found yerselves a nice gooey mummy. Congratulations.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Ya know if ya dry him out, you can sell him for firewood.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Scarabs, flesh eaters, I found them inside our friend's coffin. They can stay alive for years living off the flesh of a corpse, or in this case...

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Famished.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Very slowly.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: He certainly was not a popular fellow when they planted him.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: According to my readings, our friend suffered the HOM-DAI, the worst of all ancient Egyptian curses, one reserved for only the most evil blasphemers. In all of my research, I've never read of this curse actually having been performed.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes, they never used it because they feared it so. It's written, that if a victim of the HOM-DAI should ever arise, he would bring with him the ten plagues of Egypt.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Like what that Moses guy did to that Pharaoh guy?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: That's one way of putting it.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Let's see, there was frogs, flies, locusts...

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: Hail and fire.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: The sun turning black.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Water turning to blood.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And my personal favorite: people covered in boils and sores.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Fried gizzard anyone?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: It's just a book, no harm ever came from a book.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Ahm kum Ra. Ahm kum Dei.

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: NO! NOOOO! YOU MUST NOT!

Speaker: egyptologist
Dialogue: What have we done?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Did you see that!? Grasshoppers! Billions of grasshoppers!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: This is not a plague. It's generational. Every so many years the locusts of Egypt have a population explosion and they all take flight.

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: Daniels! Henderson!

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: Daniels?... is that you?

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: Henderson?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: EVY!?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh thank goodness, you're one of the Americans, aren't you?

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Anck-su-namun?

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: RUN, YOU SONS-A-BITCHES! RUUUUN!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Help me,... please,... help me.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Kadeesh pharos Anck-su-namun!

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: ANCK-SU-NAMUUUUUN!!!!

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: I told you to leave or die, you refused, and now you may have killed us all. For you have unleashed the creature that we have feared for more than four thousand years.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: No mortal weapons can kill this creature. He is not of this world.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: May the good Lord protect and watch over me as a shepherd watches over his flock. And may Satan in all his forms be vanquished forever.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: The language of the slaves.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: I may have use for you. And the rewards will be great.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Where are the other sacred jars?

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: You bastards!

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: What did you do to him!?

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: We saved him! Saved him before the creature could finish his work. Now leave, all of you, quickly, before he finishes you all.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: You're not going to kill us?

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: We must now hunt him down, and try and find a way to kill him, before he consumes the earth. Allah be with us.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Know this, the creature will be coming for you. He must consummate the curse. And until he does, he will never eat, he will never sleep, and he will never stop.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: ANCK-SU-NAMUUUUUN!!!!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Having an encounter with a four thousand year old walking-talking corpse tends to convert one.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No, we are not.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: No we are not. We woke him up, and we must try and stop him.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Alright then, Me, I,... I read the book, I woke him up and I intend to stop him.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Then we'll have to find some immortal ones.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: According to that Book, once this creature has been reborn, his curse will spread, and as he grows in strength, so will his curse grow, infecting the people until the whole of the earth is destroyed.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: It's everybody's problem!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: That's what I am to you? A contract?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I'm staying.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: You left me! You left me in the desert to rot.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: This is Prince Imhotep, High Priest of Osiris.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: The Prince does not like to be touched by other humans. A Silly eastern superstition, I'm afraid.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: He has come to help Mister Burns. Somehow I feel responsible.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Do you know where I can steal some?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: I'm the last of the Royal Force still stationed here, you know? All the other laddies died in the air and were buried in the sand.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Ever since the end of the Great War, there hasn't been a single challenge worthy of a man like me.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: I just wish I would've chucked it with the other laddies, gone down in a flame of glory, instead of sitting around here, rotting from boredom and booze!

Speaker: burns
Dialogue: The drawer there, spectacles.  As you see, I won't be needing them.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Mister Burns, Prince Imhotep thanks you for your spectacles, -- and for your eyes,... and for your tongue.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: But I am afraid more is needed, the Prince says he must finish the job, consummate the curse which you and your friends have brought down upon yourselves.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Sweet Jesus! That tasted just like,... like...

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: "And the rivers and waters of Egypt went red and were as blood."

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Who's here!?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: The creature!? Are you sure!?

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: You saved me from the undead. For this, I shall make you immortal.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: The curse. The curse.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: There's only one person I know who can possibly give us some answers.

Speaker: everybody
Dialogue: YOU!

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Miss Carnavon. Gentlemen.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: What is he doing here?

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Do you truly wish to know? Or would you prefer to just shoot us?

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: You will not believe it.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: We are part of an ancient secret society, the cult-of-the-Mumia, and we have a sacred mission, passed down through thirty-nine generations. For over four thousand years we have guarded The City Of The Dead. we are sworn at manhood to do any and all in our power to stop the High Priest Imhotep from being reborn into this world.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: And because of you, we have failed.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: And you think this justifies killing innocent people!?

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: To have stopped this creature? Yes!

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: According to the ancients, cat's are the guardians at the gates of the underworld. Imhotep will fear them until he is fully regenerated, and then he will fear nothing.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Right! And ya know how he gets fully regenerated?! By killing everybody who opened that chest and sucking us dry! That's how!

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Yes, the creature must first try and regenerate, and then he will attempt to resurrect the one he has loved for more than four thousand years.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Anck-su-namun.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: In the necropolis, when I saw him, - alive,... walking, he called me Anck- su-namun. And then in Mister Burns' quarters he tried to kiss me.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: It is because it was you who read from the Book. He has chosen you to be the human sacrifice needed to regenerate the body of Anck-su-namun.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: This is not good. Not good at all.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Tonight is the full moon. The moon of Osiris. It will begin tonight.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: "...and he stretched forth his hands towards the heavens, and there was darkness throughout the land of Egypt."

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: We must stop him from regenerating.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Who opened that chest?

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Well, there was me and Daniels here and then poor Burns of course, oh yeah, and that Egyptologist fella.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Naw, he scrammed outta there,

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: We must find the Egyptologist and bring him back here to the safety of the fort, before the creature can get to him.

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: The hell with that! I'm not goin' nowhere! We're safe here.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm not leavin, this fort for nothin'.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Who put you in charge? You can't just leave me behind like some old suitcase. I'm the one responsible for this mess and I intend to be the one to clean it up.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: What friend? You're my only friend.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: It is better to be the right hand of the Devil,... than in his path. As long as I serve him, I am immune.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: You shall see.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: The book! The black book they found at Hamunaptra! Imhotep wants it back. Said to me it would be worth it's weight in diamonds.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: And your sister.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: That looked rather painful.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes, I know, I do that to people.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And then he'll be coming after Evy.

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Ten o'clock! All is well!

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: The hell with this. I'm goin, downstairs to get me a drink. You want somethin'?

Speaker: henderson
Dialogue: Yeah, get me a glass of bourbon, a shot of bourbon and a bourbon chaser.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You called me your girl?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I think you were jealous

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: Shut-up! JUST SHUT-UP! We gotta do somethin'! we gotta do somethin, NOW! Before it's too late!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Last month I came across an inscription that mentioned The Book Of The Dead.

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: That book we found at Hamunaptra?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes. I dismissed it, because it talked about bringing people back from the dead. A notion I was unwilling to believe.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And now he's going to use it to bring his girlfriend back

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: And if he succeeds, the two of them together will bring about the apocalypse.

Speaker: the curator
Dialogue: The plagues we have seen so far, are merely Imhotep flexing his muscles. Only at the moment of Anck-su-namun's resurrection will he be truly invincible.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I'm thinking that if the black Book Of The Dead can bring people back to life --

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: -- then perhaps, the golden Book Of The Living can return them to the underworld.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Exactly --

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: -- And read the sacred incantations contained inside it.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Correct, And that's when --

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: It has begun. The beginning of the end.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Not quite yet it hasn't. C'mon.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Got it!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Since the black Book of The Dead was found inside the statue of Anubis, then according to this, the golden Book of The Living should be inside...

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: daniels
Dialogue: WHAT!?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: The golden Book Of The Living, is inside the statue of Horus.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Which would be located not far to the east of the Anubis statue.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: If we want to kill the creature, yes.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Anck-su-namun! Anck-su-namun!

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Imhotep! IMHOTEP!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: He's gorgeous.

Speaker: the curator
Dialogue: He has consummated the curse, now all he need do is raise Anck-su-namun from the dead, then it will be the end of us, and the beginning for them.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Koontash dai na.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Take his hand and he will spare the others.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Any bright ideas?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: I have no choice.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Keetah mi pharos, aja nilo, isirlan.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Come with me my princess. It is time to make you mine, forever.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: All eternity, idiot.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You better think of something, because if he turns me into a mummy, you're the first one I'm coming after.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes, I know, and I'd like to keep them.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Hey that's mine -- !

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Be calm. There is still time. We can stop him yet.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Pared oos.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: NOOO!!

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Kill them.

Speaker: curator
Dialogue: Go! Find a way! Kill the creature!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I'm with you, old man. No one touches my sister like that and gets away with it.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Yes. To Hamunaptra. To perform the ritual.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And what ritual would that be?

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: The ritual to bring the body of Anck- su-namun back to life.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: And how does one do that?

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: By reading the Book Of The Dead.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Oh yes, of course.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: And then killing your sister.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Imhotep is now able to cross the desert with great haste.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Begging your pardon, but I wasn't quite clear on that last part.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: If he arrives before us, it will be too late.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Did you say 'kill' my sister?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: So what's your little problem got to do with His Majesty's Royal Air Corp?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Is it dangerous?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: By Jove, do you really think so?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Everybody else we've bumped into has died, why not you?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: So what's the challenge then?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Winston Havlock at your service, sir!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: What just happened?

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: All I remember is him turning into a blast of sand,... and then I remember nothing.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Hang on, men!

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: We're going down!

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Here I come, laddies!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Stop it! You'll kill them!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Excuse me... A little help would be useful... IF IT'S NOT TOO MUCH TROUBLE!!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: He's a big fellow with pointy ears and a face like a falcon.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Keep moving.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You know, nasty little fellows such as yourself, always get their comeuppance.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh yes, always.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I say, look at that.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Say, gents! You should come have a look at this.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Prince Imhotep wants your heart.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Tell him, I'm truly flattered... but that it's already taken.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: He wants your heart and your brain, your liver, your kidneys...

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: ...and how do you say? Those slimy things, in your stomach?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Intestines.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Yeah! Them.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: You only want me for my organs?!

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Priests. Imhotep's priests.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: They are evil, cursed, they matter not.

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: Kill them! Kill them all! And bring me the Book Of The Living!

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: My turn.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: I'm out.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: There he is!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Hello Horus old boy.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Allow me.

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Keep digging!

Speaker: ardeth ray
Dialogue: Save the girl! Kill the creature!

Speaker: imhotep
Dialogue: With your death, my love and I will be invincible!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I found it, Evy! I found it

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Shut-up and get me off of here!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Open the book, Jonathan! Open the book! That's the only way to kill him!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I can't open it! It's locked or something!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: We need the key!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: What do I do, Evy!? What do I do!?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Read the inscription on the cover!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Keetash-something, naraba-something.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Ebarra im hatu Kashka ummmmm -- ?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Rasheem Aaaaa ANUBIS!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Oh boy.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: You have got to be joking?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Finish the inscription, idiot!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Ummm, Hootash im... Hootash im now what is this last symbol here?

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: What's it look like!?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: It's an Anck symbol, with two little squiggly lines above it, and a bird, a stork! on either side.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Ah! Ah! Ahmenophus!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Yes,... I see.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Hootash im Ahmenophus!

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: I got it!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Kadeesh mal! Kadeesh mal! Pared oos! PARED OOS!!

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Death is only the beginning.

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: O'CONNELL!!

Speaker: beni
Dialogue: Go away.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: Well,... I guess we go home empty handed.
